title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.24 - Executive Order No. 24: [Amending Executive Order No. 61 (Section 1.61, supra) and No. 19 (Section 3.19, supra).]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.24 - Executive Order No. 24: [Amending Executive Order No. 61 (Section 1.61, supra) and No. 19 (Section 3.19, supra).]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, By an Order dated the thirteenth day of October, nineteen hundred seventy-two, as amended by my Order dated the nineteenth day
of November, nineteen hundred seventy-five, an Extraordinary Special and Trial

Term of the Supreme Court in and for the County of New York was appointed; and
WHEREAS, By said Order the Honorable John M. Murtagh, a

Justice of the Supreme Court of the State of New York, First Judicial District, was designated to hold said Extraordinary Special and Trial Term of the Supreme

Court; and
WHEREAS, The designation of the Honorable John M. Murtagh
has been terminated by death of said Honorable Justice; NOW, THEREFORE, it appearing to my satisfaction that the
public interest requires it, and in accordance with Article VI, Section 27 of
the Constitution, statute and law in such case made and provided, I do hereby
designate the Honorable Leonard H. Sandler, a Justice of the Supreme Court of
the State of New York, First Judicial District, to hold the said Extraordinary

Special and Trial Term in and for the County of New York, in the place and
stead of the Honorable John M. Murtagh. I do further direct that copies of the notice of the
designation hereinabove made and provided for shall be released and distributed
to the general press. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: January 19, 1976

Executive Order No. 24.1
WHEREAS, By an Order dated the thirteenth day of October, nineteen hundred seventy-two, an Extraordinary Special and Trial Term of the

Supreme Court in and for the County of New York was appointed; and
WHEREAS, By order dated the nineteenth day of January, nineteen hundred seventy-six, the Honorable Leonard H. Sandler, a Justice of
the Supreme Court of the State of New York, First Judicial District, was
designated to hold said Extraordinary Special and Trial Term of the Supreme

Court; and
WHEREAS, The designation of the Honorable Leonard H. Sandler is hereby terminated in view of the designation of said Honorable

Justice as a Justice of the Appellate Division, First Department; NOW, THEREFORE, it appearing to my satisfaction that the
public interest requires it, and in accordance with article VI, section 27 of
the Constitution, statute and law in such case made and provided, I do hereby
designate the Honorable Ernst H. Rosenberger, a Justice of the Supreme Court of
the State of New York, First Judicial District, to hold the said Extraordinary

Special and Trial Term in and for the County of New York, in the place and
stead of the Honorable Leonard H. Sandler. I do further direct that copies of the notice of the
designation hereinabove made and provided for shall be released and distributed
to the general press. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: January 5, 1978

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
3.24

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
